definition: to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.english: The funny cunning agent uses his gum gun before aurora or after dusk.
sentences.chinese: 幽默靈巧的賽跑者在日出之前或日落之後使用膠皮槍。

sentences.english: Many charity races like Race for the Cure also have team training programs.
sentences.chinese: 許多慈善團體如賽跑會也會有團隊訓練計劃。

sentences.english: Before the end of the race,he lapped the other runners.
sentences.chinese: 賽跑結束前，他比其他賽跑者領先了一圈。

sentences.english: Before the end of the race,he lapped the other runners.
sentences.chinese: 賽跑結束前，他比其他賽跑者領先了一圈。

sentences.english: The runners set off at a pace.
sentences.chinese: 賽跑謅以極高的速度起跑。

sentences.english: But he's also raced against a yak (in a sack) in Mongolia…
sentences.chinese: 而他也曾在蒙古套着袋子與一隻犁牛賽跑。

sentences.english: Rabbit and refuses to obey, and race results ranked in the dragon's front.
sentences.chinese: 兔子又不服，和龍賽跑，結果排在了龍的前面。

sentences.english: "It is working against time, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “這是一項與時間賽跑的工作，”他說。

sentences.english: I've entered you and Dan in the sack race.
sentences.chinese: 我已經安排你和丹蔘加套袋賽跑。

sentences.english: Every morning he spent hours training for the race.
sentences.chinese: 他每天甄晨花兩各小時練媳賽跑。

sentences.english: It looks as if he will win the 1500-meter race.
sentences.chinese: 看起來他可能要獲得1500米賽跑的冠軍。

sentences.english: Everybody believes he will be the winner of the 100-metre race.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都認爲他會是100米賽跑的冠軍。

sentences.english: A slow runner will not win races.
sentences.chinese: 跑得慢的人不會在賽跑中獲勝。

sentences.english: The fast runner set the pace, and the others followed.
sentences.chinese: 跑的較快的賽跑者決定步速，起他的人則着跑。

sentences.english: You and your partner need to be headed in the same direction in this race.
sentences.chinese: 你和你的伴侶要在這場賽跑中一起朝同一個方向前進。

definition: to warm up (sports)/(fig.) to prepare/to get in condition
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
to force someone to do something
to match one's strength with/to compete/more competitive/to set oneself against sb/disobliging/to make a special effort
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
the end/end point/finishing line (in a race)/destination/terminus/CL:個|个[ge4]
